page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT
page.content: IN THE 18TH CENTURY COMMON JOBS IN LOANHEAD WERE{MINERS,COBBLERS, {MILLWORKERS,SERVANTS,AND FARMERS. }IN 1750 ABOUT 98 OUT OF 100 PEOPLE WORKED IN FIELDS.IN 1850 ABOUT 16 PEOPLE OUT OF 100 PEOPLE WORKED IN FIELDS AS FARMERS HAD BETTER PLOUGHS AND BETTER KNOWLEDGE.IN 1985 ABOUT 2 PEOPLE OUT OF EVERY 100 ARE FARMERS.MACHINES HAVE CHANGED LOTS OF PEOPLES LIVES. THE MAN RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS WAS JAMES WATT WHO DISCOVERED THE POWER OF STEAM.THIS MEANT MACHINES BECAME COMMON.TODAY IN 1985 COMMON JOBS IN LOANHEAD ARE{ELECTRICIANS,COMPUTER {PROGRAMMERS,ENGINEERS AND MINERS.}IN { {MIDLOTHIAN DISTRICT}THERE ARE ONLY TWO PITS LEFT,AT ONE TIME THERE WERE OVER TWENTY.MANY WORKERS{COMMUTE}TO EDINBURGH FROM LOANHEAD.
